title: Portfolio AI Knowledge Fabric - Graph-Powered Semantic Layer
summary: A SaaS-style platform that unobtrusively enriches enterprise knowledge by layering AI over a graph-powered semantic data fabric.
problem: Organizations struggle with fragmented data spread across multiple silos, making it difficult to gain contextual insights, identify relationships between entities, and surface actionable knowledge. Traditional BI solutions are reactive, disconnected, and require manual curation.
solution: Built a data-centric, graph-powered semantic layer that sits above existing enterprise systems. It ingests structured and unstructured data, constructs a knowledge graph, applies ML/NLP models for semantic enrichment, and exposes an API layer for SaaS applications to query knowledge contextually, without disrupting underlying systems.

key_components: Graph database storing entities, relationships, and metadata
ETL pipelines to ingest data from internal systems and SaaS apps
ML/NLP enrichment sidecars for semantic understanding
API layer exposing contextual knowledge to SaaS services

design_patterns: CQRS for separation of read/write workloads

key_components: S3 + Athena for analytical batch queries

challenges: Integrating AI enrichment without disrupting existing systems
Mapping heterogeneous data sources into a unified knowledge graph
Maintaining low-latency semantic query responses at scale
Ensuring consistency and correctness across dynamically updated knowledge
Handling large-scale unstructured data and streaming events

metrics.entity_relationship_coverage: Expanded to 95% of critical enterprise entities

impact.business_outcome: Teams can discover contextual knowledge instantly, surface hidden relationships, and make data-driven decisions without touching or modifying underlying legacy systems.
